snippet.textDisplay:
. . The assumption mentioned is that CO2 is the threat, while particulates are scrubbed. However, in conflict with mainstream institutions of science with corporate funding -- We find that 400 parts per million of CO2 in the atmosphere require a far greater percentage of CO2 -- some 25 to 50 times greater -- as necessary before any greenhouse warming effect is possible in the atmosphere . . that a basic element of life (we are carbon-based life forms) should be considered a threat when we require CO2 in the process of photosynthesis to feed nearly all of life, directly and through the food chain.

Corporate funding of universities and controlling interests in corporate media are that which control the climate change/global warming narrative for corrupt purposes -- in spite of this fraud repeatedly exposed -- yet ignored by a corrupt media culture that has shown no sign of journalistic integrity for years . . other than celebrity drama . . Normalization rather than conspiracy is how influence and corruption create and take precedence, so that awareness is hostage to the needs for anything other than ourselves to define what is real and acceptable -- the need for any form of consensus to rule us unaware, lest we ever accept responsibility.
snippet.textOriginal:
.  . The assumption mentioned is that CO2 is the threat, while particulates are scrubbed.  However, in conflict with mainstream institutions of science with corporate funding -- We find that 400 parts per million of CO2 in the atmosphere require a far greater percentage of CO2 -- some 25 to 50 times greater -- as necessary before any greenhouse warming effect is possible in the atmosphere .  . that a basic element of life (we are carbon-based life forms) should be considered a threat when we require CO2 in the process of photosynthesis to feed nearly all of life, directly and through the food chain.  

Corporate funding of universities and controlling interests in corporate media are that which control the climate change/global warming narrative for corrupt purposes -- in spite of this fraud repeatedly exposed -- yet ignored by a corrupt media culture that has shown no sign of journalistic integrity for years .  . other than celebrity drama .  . Normalization rather than conspiracy is how influence and corruption create and take precedence, so that awareness is hostage to the needs for anything other than ourselves to define what is real and acceptable -- the need for any form of consensus to rule us unaware, lest we ever accept responsibility.

snippet.textDisplay: In the past 100 years global temperatures have risen by 1.3 degrees celsius. We know that some portion of that increase is manmade, but nobody can tell you the exact proportion. Does it mean we're all doomed? Since 1980, the earth has become 40% more lush and green, mostly in semi-arid areas. So global warming has some positive impacts as well. I don't think that we need to worry about it, or do anything about it, other than learning how to adapt to a changing environment. Don't stop eating meat or buy an electric car. Live life as normal and in the end, the earth will be fine.
snippet.textOriginal: In the past 100 years global temperatures have risen by 1.3 degrees celsius. We know that some portion of that increase is manmade, but nobody can tell you the exact proportion. Does it mean we're all doomed? Since 1980, the earth has become 40% more lush and green, mostly in semi-arid areas. So global warming has some positive impacts as well. I don't think that we need to worry about it, or do anything about it, other than learning how to adapt to a changing environment. Don't stop eating meat or buy an electric car. Live life as normal and in the end, the earth will be fine.

snippet.textDisplay:
​@Just trying to make a change According to NASA we've had a change of ~6 - 8 inches in the sea level over the past 100 years. Various species will have to adapt to the changing climate, including humans.

Climate activists should not push a climate change agenda without the consideration of humanity, which is what they're currently doing. They're so radicalized that they're willing to sacrifice the poor around the world for their approach to energy transformation.

I'm not a climate change denier. I'm a climate change realist and a humanist. We cannot deny the poorer nations access and usage of fossil fuels to achieve prosperity. Renewable energy, like solar is a great supplement to base load, which has to be either nuclear, coal or natural gas (realistically a mix of all).

The US as an example has decreased carbon emissions by 15% by switch a lot of coal to natural gas, but the liberals don't want fracking, or pipelines, or even mining of resources required for electric vehicles. This is an unrealistic constraint. Policy makers are just moving the source of pollution from their location to foreign locations, then increasing pollution, because resources need to be shipped in causing even higher carbon emissions.

snippet.textDisplay:
This is not rubbish, nor brainwashing. Scientists have been studying these phenomena for many decades, nearly a century. Volcanoes are very damaging to the environment, however their impact is more local and short term. You can not deny that there are an uncountable number of man-made pollutants all around the world, currently releasing their waste chemicals into our atmosphere.

Our climate - that includes land, air and sea - is not used to these suddenly abundant chemicals. When events like this have happened in the past, where temperature suddenly increases (which it has been doing), there have been mass extinction events.
snippet.textOriginal:

Volcanoes are very damaging to the environment, however their impact is more local and short term. You can not deny that there are an uncountable number of man-made pollutants all around the world, currently releasing their waste chemicals into our atmosphere.

Our climate - that includes land, air and sea - is not used to these suddenly abundant chemicals. When events like this have happened in the past, where temperature suddenly increases (which it has been doing), there have been mass extinction events.

snippet.textDisplay:
Coca Cola, one of the biggest bottlers and distributors of beverages /in the world/ TELLS US people prefer plastic bottles over glass! Infinitely recyclable glass!

Personally, with the rate of inflation in the US, I don't care if the price of soda needs to go up another dollar or whatever because of shrink and the cost of shipping--the cost of my groceries changes every time Igo grocery shopping. First off, I think the company should eat the cost of changing their packaging. Second, fuck shareholders, what purpose do they actually serve. Third, we forget that soda--basically candy--is a luxury.

There. I have solved two problems at once: One of the biggest sources of plastic production and plastic waste. The true recyclability of plastic is a lie and it is more deeply annoying to me by the day.

snippet.textDisplay:
I may have a solution (yeah I know, there is no ‘solution’ but I think it may work, correct me if im wrong)


How to reverse climate change:
We already have progress on changing to clean energy sources, maybe fusion would be a possibility in helion.

Here is my solution: we use carbon dioxide, seperate it into carbon and oxygen, and use that to create titanium dioxide, a white pigment which is used mostly in art, but reflects ≈97% of light. We place this pigment over a tarp held by poles placed in the water and essentially my idea is that this will allow sunlight to reflect back out of the planet to keep the planet colder, otherwise the darker ocean will absorb solar radiation, heating up our planet. The only problem with this is probably weather and animals, but easily fixed by adding holes for water to seep through and making it slightly higher so animals won’t eat through it. The only other problem I can think of is that the darkness under water may kill some seaweed, but we can add some illumination to mimic sunlight. This will obviously be very expensive but think of it as a way to terraform earth a bit to cool it down and prevent climate change to global warming. And while the tarps as placed, we can focus on reducing carbon emissions and eventually remove all the tarps. It’s a good way to control temperature while we figure out how to lower the greenhouse gas concentration.


You can argue ‘there’s no going back’ but people who say that aren’t thinking enough, we mustn’t give up just because we don’t think it’s possible, we already managed to change the earths atmospheric composition, why can’t we do it again?
snippet.textOriginal:
I may have a solution (yeah I know, there is no ‘solution’ but I think it may work, correct me if im wrong)


How to reverse climate change:
We already have progress on changing to clean energy sources, maybe fusion would be a possibility in helion.

Here is my solution: we use carbon dioxide, seperate it into carbon and oxygen, and use that to create titanium dioxide, a white pigment which is used mostly in art, but reflects ≈97% of light. We place this pigment over a tarp held by poles placed in the water and essentially my idea is that this will allow sunlight to reflect back out of the planet to keep the planet colder, otherwise the darker ocean will absorb solar radiation, heating up our planet. The only problem with this is probably weather and animals, but easily fixed by adding holes for water to seep through  and making it slightly higher so animals won’t eat through it. The only other problem I can think of is that the darkness under water may kill some seaweed, but we can add some illumination to mimic sunlight. This will obviously be very expensive but think of it as a way to terraform earth a bit to cool it down and prevent climate change to global warming. And while the tarps as placed, we can focus on reducing carbon emissions and eventually remove all the tarps. It’s a good way to control temperature while we figure out how to lower the greenhouse gas concentration.


You can argue ‘there’s no going back’ but people who say that aren’t thinking enough, we mustn’t give up just because we don’t think it’s possible, we already managed to change the earths atmospheric composition, why can’t we do it again?

snippet.textDisplay:
I’m big in speculative evolution and the carbon capture gives me an idea for a prompt.

Humanity successfully reduces the amount of carbon dioxide in the air using bioengineered forests, but unfortunately returns the atmosphere back to Carboniferous levels. Seeing as how arthropods grew to enormous sizes back then, how would that affect modern day animals, like birds?

snippet.textDisplay:
You could fix global warming and super volcano eruptions with the same solution:
Releasing the pressure from a super volcano would create enough energy to get us off fossil fuels.
I thought of a way to release the pressure.
The two main limitations to releasing the pressure from super volcanoes is that if you release the pressure in the center you could cause it to explode the way around that problem is to release the pressure further out, like a balloon if you release further out and slowly work your way in it can deflate without popping.
The second limitation is that you can't dig down to a super volcano without the equipment getting too hot to dig the way around that problem is instead of digging melt your way down to the lava.
Giant mirror fields create molten salt power plants, instead of pointing them at salt point the mirrors at a magnifying glass that melts the ground down to the lava and releases the pressure from the volcano while simultaneously using the released pressure to create power and get us off fossil fuels.
snippet.textOriginal:
You could fix global warming and super volcano eruptions with the same solution:
Releasing the pressure from a super volcano would create enough energy to get us off fossil fuels.
I thought of a way to release the pressure.
The two main limitations to releasing the pressure from super volcanoes is that if you release the pressure in the center you could cause it to explode the way around that problem is to release the pressure further out, like a balloon if you release further out and slowly work your way in it can deflate without popping.
The second limitation is that you can't dig down to a super volcano without the equipment getting too hot to dig the way around that problem is instead of digging melt your way down to the lava.
Giant mirror fields create molten salt power plants, instead of pointing them at salt point the mirrors at a magnifying glass that melts the ground down to the lava and releases the pressure from the volcano while simultaneously using the released pressure to create power and get us off fossil fuels.

snippet.textDisplay:
All of this video is obsolete or wrong if the "crisis" is overblown. Which it is.

We can do all the positive things with less coercion and mandates. We can tax oil and gas and NOT ban it. We can drive hybrids, which are far less damaging to the environment than massive production of LI batteries, which there isn't enough raw supply of anyway.

This video is all nice and balanced, until you remember that ALL the CRISIS! mongering is over done. Adaptation is a far better strategy.
snippet.textOriginal:

This video is all nice and balanced, until you remember that ALL the CRISIS! mongering is over done. Adaptation is a far better strategy.

In terms of making the climate colder it can happen. The weather will vary and fluctuate in every part of the world. But if your waiting for a terrifying climate catastrophe you won’t have to wait long👌🏽.

It at least discussed the fact that richer countries need to "get poorer" and that our understanding of "economy" needs to be updated. These are the realest of solutions imo.

snippet.textDisplay: sea level is rising at the same rate as 100 years ago ; polar bears and penguins are thriving ; the great barrier reef has its highest coral cover ever recorded ; there is still arctic sea ice year round ; tropical storm activity , floods and drought shows no change in trend ( ipcc ) ; there is less hunger and poverty than ever before ; humans are living longer than ever before . tell me again why we want to destroy the energy infrastructure that has made all this progress possible and replace it with intermittent , unreliable , untested , expensive infrastructure mandated by politicians and bureaucrats?
